entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 356,922Chapters: 54/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn‚Äôt end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they‚Äôre reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 559,492Chapters: 61/?Kudos: 70

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who‚Äôve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: My Empty Cup On Your Nightstand (my bones in your teeth)
entry.summary:
Author: queerbaited_by_ABC

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,435Chapters: 5/10Kudos: 158

Summary: Eddie gently grabs Bucks wrist, stopping him from pushing into the booth after Karen and Ravi, sliding in himself before finally motioning for Buck to sit in the free space. Buck does so, but not before tilting his head in question, a vaguely amused smile resting on his lips. "What was that about?" "You can stretch your bad knee out of the booth like this," Eddie explains, like Bucks heart isn't trying to beat its way out of his chest, like it's not trying curl up in Eddies lap like a satisfied cat in a patch of afternoon sunlight. "So you're not uncomfortable all night." "Oh. Uh, thanks‚Äîthank you." Buck stammers.or - evan buckleys half-assed attempt to run from the chasm of love that has eddie diaz‚Äôs name engraved in it‚Äîeven if maddie and chim are doing their level best to throw him into it, where it be it willingly or with Buck kicking and screaming the whole way there.

entry.title: You're Not Unlovable (and I‚Äôll Prove it to You)
entry.summary:
Author: MurkyWaters051

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,090Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 33

Summary: Buck is interviewing for the role of lieutenant in the firehouse. He‚Äôs 99% sure he‚Äôll get the title even if he bombed the interview with Bobby. He‚Äôs basically been doing everything a lieutenant would be doing for the last couple of years, this is just what‚Äôs going to make it official. He‚Äôs still insanely nervous about it, he‚Äôs been practicing his answers to the questions he thinks Bobby would ask for weeks. Eddie has been helping him but he is 100% sure Buck will get the title no matter what his answers are; so he‚Äôs not taking their practices too seriously. Which is sweet in a way but is definitely stressing Buck out even more. ‚ÄúBuck. It‚Äôs not like Bobby is going to be mean to you or not give you the title, you can chill out a bit man.‚Äù Said Eddie as he yawned and sat back against Buck‚Äôs couch. He was only half right. or Buck's self-worth and self-efficacy issues are brought to light by the most important people in his life and Eddie is left to pick up the pieces...if Buck will let him.

entry.title: Spectator
entry.summary:
Author: Desscard

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 42,046Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 49

Summary: The last thing Buck remembered was the zipper. He remembered the heavy, black plastic sliding shut, sealing away the pale, mud-streaked face that had been looking at him with such cold anger just hours ago. He saw the blue tinge of Eddie‚Äôs lips, the absolute stillness of his chest. He heard the sound‚Äîthat sharp, final zzzzzt‚Äîcutting through the rain, erasing the last piece of Eddie Diaz from the world. Then, the silence hit him. Not the quiet of the storm, but the suffocating, heavy silence of a world that was suddenly empty. Or:Buck gets stuck in his personal Hell - watching Eddie die over and over again in that well.
